instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: 820 4924 no power, no water damage, green light on mag safe 12.59v PPBUS g3h, 5v pp5vs5, 0v pp5vs4, 0v <SIGNAL>P5VS4_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: Any history? Checked all rails for shorts?

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: CPU VCORE is shorted, is it safe to inject voltage into this line to find the short, or am I going to kill the CPU?

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: Define "shorted", need resistance in Ohm. Do not inject anything on Vcore!

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: That is not shorted, but it is a bit low. Is 3V present on L7560? Carefully check for power cycling on L7520, preferably with a scope as multimeter may be too slow to catch the pulse. PPVRTC present?

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message:
3.34v @ L7560
0v on L7520 cant see a cycle with Fluke, sorry no scope
3.34V on PPVRTC

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: Was this thing already messed with by someone else. These do not "just" fail like this very often, I really want to know is there is any back story.

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message: I contacted the owner this morning, he said nothing happened more than the machine died in use. I've looked this board up and down, and I can confidently say that no one has messed around with this board before.

threads.title: 820 4924 missing s4
threads.message:
Ugh, that 13.2 on Vcore is kinda low. Do you have a board to compare? This may well be a dead CPU :(

Also you say green light on charger but this must turn orange in all cases, please confirm that. Also some of these boards seem to need a working battery to turn on, is <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> present?
